inline.description:
Channel - modify
————————————————————————————
  1. In a command line window set to the directory where 'mmctl' is installed in
  2. Run "mmctl auth login https://mysql.test.mattermost.com --name mysql.test --username john.doe --password mysupersecret"

    Note: Enter valid username and password for a system admin user
inline.expectedResult: • You will get feedback saying "credentials for mysql.test stored"

customFields.Related ticket(s): (Story) Port the "channel modify" subcommand from Mattermost CLI to mmctl — MM-20829
customFields.Important notes about this step: Note: There is no feedback in mmctl window. You need to be logged in to the server to see the channel converted

inline.description: 1. Run "mmctl channel modify myteam:mychannel --private" to convert a public channel to a private channel
inline.expectedResult: • You will see the converted channel move to UNREADS in Mattermost and a system message saying "this channel has been converted to a private channel" is posted in the channel

inline.description: 1. Run "mmctl channel modify myteam:mychannel --public" to convert a private channel to a public channel
inline.expectedResult: • You will see the converted channel move to PUBLIC CHANNELS in Mattermost and a system message saying "This channel has been converted to a Public Channel and can be joined by any team member." is posted in the channel
